DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Estrogen Receptor Status Progesterone Receptor Status Stratification Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the coded value related to the presence of estrogen and progesterone receptors, estrogen and progesterone receptor levels measured in a primary tumor or in metastases, as a stratification point, classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis, for participation in research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Estrogen Receptor Status Progesterone Receptor Status Stratification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of estrogen and progesterone receptors, estrogen and progesterone receptor levels measured in a primary tumor or in metastases, as a stratification point, classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis, for participation in research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredName: Estrogen Receptor Status Progesterone Receptor Status Stratification
Property.preferredDefinition: The estrogen receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases.  There are essentially two distinct forms of breast cancer, one that tends to have an early onset and is characterized by an ER- status, and one that tends to have a late onset and:Indicates the progesterone receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases. (>=10 is positive if measured in fmols/mg cytosol protein; Otherwise use institutional standards):The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: The estrogen receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases.  There are essentially two distinct forms of breast cancer, one that tends to have an early onset and is characterized by an ER- status, and one that tends to have a late onset and is characterized by an ER+ status.  However, these two variants tend to overlap with respect to age, so it is possible for a young woman to have a "late-onset" form of breast cancer and for an older woman to have an "early-onset" variant of the disease.
Indicates the progesterone receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases. (>=10 is positive if measured in fmols/mg cytosol protein; Otherwise use institutional standards)
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Clinical Study Estrogen Receptor Status Progesterone Receptor Status Stratification Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numbered system to stratify estrogen receptor and progesterone receptor status for participation on a clinical trial.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: estrogen receptor negative and progesterone receptor negative
estrogen receptor positive and/or progesterone receptor positive

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
